interestingcomments.content: It seems that Leica Photos and IOS are no good friends! To make leica Photos 2.0 and 2.1.0 work on the Iphone/IPad it seems to be necessary to cancel the existing camera and search again for the camera. The problems i am reading from IOS devices seem to me as IOS and/or the Leica Photo app will keep old data if you update from a previous version. the same problem was already ocurring with Leica Photos 2.0 and IOS Devices and it yould be solved unistalling the older Leica Photos App and reinstall the new version as this will cancel all old data. Most of IOS users could make it work this way while the update-way was a spiny journey and mostly unsuccessful. Chris

interestingcomments.content: On 7/13/2020 at 1:40 PM, scott kirkpatrick said: Let's see if they add multishot to the Fotos drive menu when they update Fotos to know about the M10-R. I'm using Fotos 2.1, and it leaves most of the camera settings as it finds them now. Is the Pro version behind on that? I have a suspicion that Fotos is being run outside of the existing product groups, with the code written by people very far away. Despite what Leica says about computational imaging being an important future direction, the skillset that is used to write iOS and Android apps is a long way from doing camera firmware. Leica has claimed they setup an in house group to take over the Fotos app. I also share your doubts about in house development.

interestingcomments.content: On 5/10/2020 at 9:13 PM, fotonutzz said: .... Really frustrating trying to connect to the app after both the camera and iPad goes to sleep, GPS Geo-tagging doesn’t work, when it does, it is 1-2 km away from the actual location. ... The Leica Fotos development team really need to read the reviews on both the AppStore and PlayStore. An error as large as 1-2 km probably means that the tablet or phone had an old geo coordinate stored in it and couldn't update it. Before blaming Fotos, check to see where the blue dot on Google or Apple maps shows up. Or is there even a blue dot (showing the phone knows its location)? Another trick I used when I was curious about how sensitive different GPS solutions were, was to take out my old Garmin hiker's GPS and see how many satellites it could find. If there are only 3-4, nothing is going to work for long. Fotos has a feedback button to let you send detailed comments and bug complaints to Leica customer service, accompanied by a full log file. You generally get an ack back from customer service. And sometimes even a detailed answer if your complaint is being worked on. I'm inured to having to make multiple attempts to get a first connection. I think there are serious timing issues in getting the wifi code sequences synchronized between phone and camera, and it seems to take some time in the field to surface all the issues that different manufacturers create. But I do already find Fotos useful, at least as a live view remote.

But I do already find Fotos useful, at least as a live view remote.

interestingcomments.content: 37 minutes ago, jaapv said: can apps like Snapseed or PS Express find it? Jaap, Afraid not and also not in any of the other photo apps I have on my iPad. I think a firmware update for the camera plus an extension of the camera selection menu in Fotos will be needed before connection can be established, with a current iOS app. Given Leica's recent poor record of dumping service and their customers in respect of any of their product, where they no longer perceive as earning from them, I don't foresee much progress being made on C112 connectivity. However, I went into some old back up hard discs and found a legacy copy of Leica Image Shuttle for iPhone. I reinstalled it on my iPhone SE and much to my surprise, it does run in iOS 13.4.1. As soon as I got that running and connected to the camera in direct wifi mode, the software connected and I can access the SD card and control the camera. I just suspect that an update from Apple will kill the app sooner rather than later. Wilson

interestingcomments.content: I rarely post, but the Leica Fotos app is a very sore spot. They literally took away the basic functionality they previously offered for free (as is offered for free with the purchase of a camera by every other camera manufacturer) and brought that functionality back requesting $50.00 a year for infinity to get the functions returned to us. I am fine with paying the Leica premium for their great cameras and lenses but the annual subscription I found somewhat insulting. Actually, I did find it insulting. The "features" they added became even less relevant with the introduction of IpadOS. The SD card issues with the SL2 and Fotos app as well as the blocking of DNG downloads on Q2 were truly brand damaging. They are just lucky so many of their customers never use their app/phone with their cameras. This will not help them attract new/younger buyers. Very frustrating coming from Leica. This is also a potentially bad sign of what is to come as they transform into a "software" company.

I completely agree – that you have completely missed the point – which is why if the QR code method of pairing fails, can I simply enter the cameras password into the app

interestingcomments.content: I think the confusion is that, when you first open the Fotos app, if you choose the big red "Leica Account" button and login with your Leica account (that is created when you register your camera on Leica's website), your "trial period" starts and if you don't opt out in 7 days, you'll be charged $50 annually. If however, you choose "Skip" below the big red button, then you can still proceed with the WLAN camera-to-phone setup (a one time thing; just tap on your camera in the app next time you use it to connect to the camera). After the WLAN setup is complete, you can still transfer images to your phone. No trial period or subscription needed. I figured this out because I did sign up for the trial period at first, then deleted the app (and also turned off the subscription on my iPhone under Settings>My Name>Subscriptions), and then reinstalled it and this time chose "Skip". I was still able to transfer photos from my CL to my iPhone this second time around. Edited August 5, 2020 by dadu007 spelling
